Hooks in Comfort Job are points in the code where developers can add custom functions or code to modify the plugin's behavior. There are two types of hooks in WordPress: action hooks and filter hooks.
Triggered at the start of the single job template.

Triggered at the end of the single job template.

Triggered before the job details are displayed.
Triggered after the job details are displayed.
Triggered when a job is published.

in the WordPress admin dashboard. This section is organized into various sections, each dedicated to specific configuration options.

Set the slug country for different pages over the plugin.
Select the page where you have placed the shortcodes.

The File Upload/Attachments Settings section allows users to manage file attachments within the Comfort Job Application plugin, particularly for the Log component. These settings ensure that file uploads are handled securely and efficiently, aligning with your operational requirements.
Text field to specify permitted file types (e.g. image/jpeg,image/png)
A numeric field where users can define the maximum allowable file size for uploads, measured in megabytes (MB).

it from our website. Core plugin is free.

doesn’t work without the core plugin

. So, before you install the pro addon you need to have the core Comfort Resume plugin installed and activated (if you want to activate this pro addon). So, Comfort Resume Pro Addon is an addon plugin for core plugin Comfort Resume.
To install Comfort Resume Pro Addon you have to purchase
from our website and then install manually.
